004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.InterpolatingMatrixTreeMap;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
020
021/**
022 * The linear time-varying differential drive controller has a similar form to the LQR, but the
023 * model used to compute the controller gain is the nonlinear model linearized around the
024 * drivetrain's current state. We precomputed gains for important places in our state-space, then
025 * interpolated between them with a LUT to save computational resources.
026 *
027 * <p>See section 8.7 in Controls Engineering in FRC for a derivation of the control law we used
028 * shown in theorem 8.7.4.
029 */
030public class LTVDifferentialDriveController {
031  private final double m_trackwidth;
032
033  // LUT from drivetrain linear velocity to LQR gain
034  private final InterpolatingMatrixTreeMap<Double, N2, N5> m_table =
035      new InterpolatingMatrixTreeMap<>();
036
037  private Matrix<N5, N1> m_error = new Matrix<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1());
038  private Matrix<N5, N1> m_tolerance = new Matrix<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1());
039
040  /** Motor voltages for a differential drive. */
041  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
042  public static class WheelVoltages {
043    public double left;
044    public double right;
045
046    public WheelVoltages() {}
047
048    public WheelVoltages(double left, double right) {
049      this.left = left;
050      this.right = right;
051    }
052  }
053
054  /** States of the drivetrain system. */
055  enum State {
056    kX(0),
057    kY(1),
058    kHeading(2),
059    kLeftVelocity(3),
060    kRightVelocity(4);
061
062    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
063    public final int value;
064
065    @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
066    State(int i) {
067      this.value = i;
068    }
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Constructs a linear time-varying differential drive controller.
073   *
074   * @param plant The drivetrain velocity plant.
075   * @param trackwidth The drivetrain's trackwidth in meters.
076   * @param qelems The maximum desired error tolerance for each state.
077   * @param relems The maximum desired control effort for each input.
078   * @param dt Discretization timestep in seconds.
079   */
080  @SuppressWarnings("LocalVariableName")
081  public LTVDifferentialDriveController(
082      LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> plant,
083      double trackwidth,
084      Vector<N5> qelems,
085      Vector<N2> relems,
086      double dt) {
087    m_trackwidth = trackwidth;
088
089    var A =
090        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N5())
091            .fill(
092                0.0,
093                0.0,
094                0.0,
095                0.5,
096                0.5,
097                0.0,
098                0.0,
099                0.0,
100                0.0,
101                0.0,
102                0.0,
103                0.0,
104                0.0,
105                -1.0 / m_trackwidth,
106                1.0 / m_trackwidth,
107                0.0,
108                0.0,
109                0.0,
110                plant.getA(0, 0),
111                plant.getA(0, 1),
112                0.0,
113                0.0,
114                0.0,
115                plant.getA(1, 0),
116                plant.getA(1, 1));
117    var B =
118        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N2())
119            .fill(
120                0.0,
121                0.0,
122                0.0,
123                0.0,
124                0.0,
125                0.0,
126                plant.getB(0, 0),
127                plant.getB(0, 1),
128                plant.getB(1, 0),
129                plant.getB(1, 1));
130    var Q = StateSpaceUtil.makeCostMatrix(qelems);
131    var R = StateSpaceUtil.makeCostMatrix(relems);
132
133    // dx/dt = Ax + Bu
134    // 0 = Ax + Bu
135    // Ax = -Bu
136    // x = -A⁻¹Bu
137    double maxV =
138        plant
139            .getA()
140            .solve(plant.getB().times(new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N1()).fill(12.0, 12.0)))
141            .times(-1.0)
142            .get(0, 0);
143
144    var x = new Matrix<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1());
145    for (double velocity = -maxV; velocity < maxV; velocity += 0.01) {
146      x.set(State.kLeftVelocity.value, 0, velocity);
147      x.set(State.kRightVelocity.value, 0, velocity);
148
149      // The DARE is ill-conditioned if the velocity is close to zero, so don't
150      // let the system stop.
151      if (Math.abs(velocity) < 1e-4) {
152        m_table.put(velocity, new Matrix<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N5()));
153      } else {
154        A.set(State.kY.value, State.kHeading.value, velocity);
155        m_table.put(velocity, new LinearQuadraticRegulator<N5, N2, N5>(A, B, Q, R, dt).getK());
156      }
157    }
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Returns true if the pose error is within tolerance of the reference.
162   *
163   * @return True if the pose error is within tolerance of the reference.
164   */
165  public boolean atReference() {
166    return Math.abs(m_error.get(0, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(0, 0)
167        && Math.abs(m_error.get(1, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(1, 0)
168        && Math.abs(m_error.get(2, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(2, 0)
169        && Math.abs(m_error.get(3, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(3, 0)
170        && Math.abs(m_error.get(4, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(4, 0);
171  }
172
173  /**
174   * Sets the pose error which is considered tolerable for use with atReference().
175   *
176   * @param poseTolerance Pose error which is tolerable.
177   * @param leftVelocityTolerance Left velocity error which is tolerable in meters per second.
178   * @param rightVelocityTolerance Right velocity error which is tolerable in meters per second.
179   */
180  public void setTolerance(
181      Pose2d poseTolerance, double leftVelocityTolerance, double rightVelocityTolerance) {
182    m_tolerance =
183        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1())
184            .fill(
185                poseTolerance.getX(),
186                poseTolerance.getY(),
187                poseTolerance.getRotation().getRadians(),
188                leftVelocityTolerance,
189                rightVelocityTolerance);
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Returns the left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
194   *
195   * <p>The reference pose, linear velocity, and angular velocity should come from a drivetrain
196   * trajectory.
197   *
198   * @param currentPose The current pose.
199   * @param leftVelocity The current left velocity in meters per second.
200   * @param rightVelocity The current right velocity in meters per second.
201   * @param poseRef The desired pose.
202   * @param leftVelocityRef The desired left velocity in meters per second.
203   * @param rightVelocityRef The desired right velocity in meters per second.
204   * @return Left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
205   */
206  @SuppressWarnings("LocalVariableName")
207  public WheelVoltages calculate(
208      Pose2d currentPose,
209      double leftVelocity,
210      double rightVelocity,
211      Pose2d poseRef,
212      double leftVelocityRef,
213      double rightVelocityRef) {
214    // This implements the linear time-varying differential drive controller in
215    // theorem 9.6.3 of https://tavsys.net/controls-in-frc.
216    var x =
217        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1())
218            .fill(
219                currentPose.getX(),
220                currentPose.getY(),
221                currentPose.getRotation().getRadians(),
222                leftVelocity,
223                rightVelocity);
224
225    var inRobotFrame = Matrix.eye(Nat.N5());
226    inRobotFrame.set(0, 0, Math.cos(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
227    inRobotFrame.set(0, 1, Math.sin(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
228    inRobotFrame.set(1, 0, -Math.sin(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
229    inRobotFrame.set(1, 1, Math.cos(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
230
231    var r =
232        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1())
233            .fill(
234                poseRef.getX(),
235                poseRef.getY(),
236                poseRef.getRotation().getRadians(),
237                leftVelocityRef,
238                rightVelocityRef);
239    m_error = r.minus(x);
240    m_error.set(
241        State.kHeading.value, 0, MathUtil.angleModulus(m_error.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
242
243    double velocity = (leftVelocity + rightVelocity) / 2.0;
244    var K = m_table.get(velocity);
245
246    var u = K.times(inRobotFrame).times(m_error);
247
248    return new WheelVoltages(u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0));
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Returns the left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
253   *
254   * <p>The reference pose, linear velocity, and angular velocity should come from a drivetrain
255   * trajectory.
256   *
257   * @param currentPose The current pose.
258   * @param leftVelocity The left velocity in meters per second.
259   * @param rightVelocity The right velocity in meters per second.
260   * @param desiredState The desired pose, linear velocity, and angular velocity from a trajectory.
261   * @return The left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
262   */
263  public WheelVoltages calculate(
264      Pose2d currentPose,
265      double leftVelocity,
266      double rightVelocity,
267      Trajectory.State desiredState) {
268    // v = (v_r + v_l) / 2     (1)
269    // w = (v_r - v_l) / (2r)  (2)
270    // k = w / v               (3)
271    //
272    // v_l = v - wr
273    // v_l = v - (vk)r
274    // v_l = v(1 - kr)
275    //
276    // v_r = v + wr
277    // v_r = v + (vk)r
278    // v_r = v(1 + kr)
279    return calculate(
280        currentPose,
281        leftVelocity,
282        rightVelocity,
283        desiredState.poseMeters,
284        desiredState.velocityMetersPerSecond
285            * (1 - (desiredState.curvatureRadPerMeter * m_trackwidth / 2.0)),
286        desiredState.velocityMetersPerSecond
287            * (1 + (desiredState.curvatureRadPerMeter * m_trackwidth / 2.0)));
288  }
289}
